name: Mauri Rose
introduction: Maurice "Mauri" Rose (MORE-ee; born May 26, 1906 in Columbus, Ohio, United States  died January 1, 1981 in Royal Oak, Michigan, United States) was a United States driver who was a three-time winner of the Indianapolis 500, in 1941, 1947 and 1948. Despite his obvious driving skill, he preferred to be known as an engineer. He was most proud of creating a device to assist amputees in driving.
